editions.flavor: The leyline buried in Krustal shatters awake again, infusing dauntless souls with freezing clarity.
The leyline buried in Krustal shatters awake again, infusing dauntless souls with freezing clarity.
The rivers of Wool Brook flow with depths concealed beneath reflections too perfect to trust.
The rivers of Wool Brook flow with depths concealed beneath reflections too perfect to trust.
The tides and waves thrash again as serpent and tortoise entwined awaken from their slumber.
The tides and waves thrash again as serpent and tortoise entwined awaken from their slumber.

effect: **On Enter:** Draw seven cards.
effect_raw: On Enter: Draw seven cards.
flavor: Convalescing waves cascade through the soul, revitalizing the body and mind from the depths.
name: Spirit of Water

result_editions.flavor: The tides and waves thrash again as serpent and tortoise entwined awaken from their slumber.

effect_html: On Enter: Draw seven cards.

effect:
**On Enter**: Put two **glimmer** counters on CARDNAME.

**Inherited Effect** — [REST]: Activate a Reaction Spell card from your memory. Pay its reserve cost only by removing that many **glimmer** counters from CARDNAME. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn.
effect_raw:
On Enter: Put two glimmer counters on Diao Chan.

Inherited Effect — REST: Activate a Reaction Spell card from your memory. Pay its reserve cost only by removing that many glimmer counters from Diao Chan. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn.
name: Diao Chan, Enchantress

rule.description: Diao Chan's activated ability changes how the reserve cost is paid. Modifiers to that reserve cost still apply and any additional non-reserve costs must still be paid.

effect_html: On Enter: Put two glimmer counters on Diao Chan.Inherited Effect —: Activate a Reaction Spell card from your memory. Pay its reserve cost only by removing that many glimmer counters from Diao Chan. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn.

effect:
**Diao Chan Lineage**

**Inherited Effect** — At the beginning of your end phase, if the amount of **glimmer** counters on CARDNAME is less than the amount of phantasias you control, put an amount of **glimmer** counters on CARDNAME equal to the difference.
effect_raw:
Diao Chan Lineage

Inherited Effect — At the beginning of your end phase, if the amount of glimmer counters on Diao Chan is less than the amount of phantasias you control, put an amount of glimmer counters on Diao Chan equal to the difference.
name: Diao Chan, Dreaming Wish
effect_html: Diao Chan LineageInherited Effect — At the beginning of your end phase, if the amount of glimmer counters on Diao Chan is less than the amount of phantasias you control, put an amount of glimmer counters on Diao Chan equal to the difference.

effect:
**Diao Chan Lineage**

**On Enter**: Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put a **wither** counter on each of them.

Whenever a non-token object an opponent controls is destroyed, you may banish it. If you do, that opponent **summons** a Flowerbud token.
effect_raw:
Diao Chan Lineage

On Enter: Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put a wither counter on each of them.

Whenever a non-token object an opponent controls is destroyed, you may banish it. If you do, that opponent summons a Flowerbud token.
name: Diao Chan, Idyll Corsage

rule.description: The destroyed object must be banished by Diao Chan's trigger from the graveyard to have its controller summon a Flowerbud token. A Flowerbud token will not be summoned on the destruction of a regalia, which never exists in the graveyard. In addition, if the destroyed card was banished before Diao Chan's trigger resolves, because this trigger's effect did not do the banishing, a Flowerbud token will also not be summoned.
Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.

The main phase trigger for wither counters is one collective trigger. In one resolution, the turn player decides to pay or not pay for objects with wither counters on them, sacrifices all objects where the all wither counters were not paid for, and then remove all wither counters from all objects they control.

effect_html: Diao Chan LineageOn Enter: Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put a wither counter on each of them.Whenever a non-token object an opponent controls is destroyed, you may banish it. If you do, that opponent summons a Flowerbud token.

effect:
Whenever a phantasia enters the field under your control, **glimpse 1**. 

[Class Bonus] **Banish CARDNAME:** Destroy target item with memory cost 0 or reserve cost 3 or less. Activate this ability only if you control three or more phantasias.
effect_raw:
Whenever a phantasia enters the field under your control, glimpse 1. 

[Class Bonus] Banish Crystalline Mirror: Destroy target item with memory cost 0 or reserve cost 3 or less. Activate this ability only if you control three or more phantasias.
name: Crystalline Mirror
effect_html: Whenever a phantasia enters the field under your control, glimpse 1. Class Bonus Banish Crystalline Mirror: Destroy target item with memory cost 0 or reserve cost 3 or less. Activate this ability only if you control three or more phantasias.

effect: [Class Bonus] **Banish Hairpin of Transience**: Put three **wither** counters on target non-champion object. *(At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with **wither** counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each **wither** counter on it, then remove **wither** counters.)*
effect_raw: [Class Bonus] Banish Hairpin of Transience: Put three wither counters on target non-champion object. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)
name: Hairpin of Transience

rule.description: The main phase trigger for wither counters is one collective trigger. In one resolution, the turn player decides to pay or not pay for objects with wither counters on them, sacrifices all objects where the all wither counters were not paid for, and then remove all wither counters from all objects they control.
Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.

effect_html: Class Bonus Banish Hairpin of Transience: Put three wither counters on target non-champion object. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay 1for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)

editions.flavor: Deep in Wonderland lies a cove of ice, where legends speak of a gryphon and turtle's waltz.
"Praying for peace won't end a war. Fighting for what you believe in will."

effect: **Negate** target card activation unless its controller pays (2). Banish the card that had its activation **negated** this way.
effect_raw: Negate target card activation unless its controller pays (2). Banish the card that had its activation negated this way.
flavor: "O'Lumina who shelters us, bind those who seek us harm in frost. Grant us peace under your blessing."
name: Frostbind

result_editions.flavor: "Praying for peace won't end a war. Fighting for what you believe in will."

rule.description: The (2) in Frostbind's negate condition is a reserve cost, and can be paid by resting objects with reservable.

If Frostbind negates an attack card, the combat phase never gets to begin. This means that On Attack effects will not trigger. The attacker remains rested if resting that unit was an additional cost of that attack card.

effect_html: Negate target card activation unless its controller pays 2. Banish the card that had its activation negated this way.

effect_html: At the beginning of your recollection phase, deal 1 unpreventable damage to your champion.

effect: At the beginning of your recollection phase, put a **wither** counter on target non-champion non-token object you control. *(At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with **wither** counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each **wither** counter on it, then remove **wither** counters.)*
effect_raw: At the beginning of your recollection phase, put a wither counter on target non-champion non-token object you control. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay (1) for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)
name: Nightshade

rule.description: Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.

The main phase trigger for wither counters is one collective trigger. In one resolution, the turn player decides to pay or not pay for objects with wither counters on them, sacrifices all objects where the all wither counters were not paid for, and then remove all wither counters from all objects they control.

effect_html: At the beginning of your recollection phase, put a wither counter on target non-champion non-token object you control. (At the beginning of a player's main phase, if they control one or more objects with wither counters on them, for each of those objects, they sacrifice it unless they pay 1for each wither counter on it, then remove wither counters.)

effect:
[Class Bonus] **Efficiency** *(This card costs **LV** less to activate. **LV** refers to your champion's level.)*

Choose any amount of non-champion objects and put two **wither** counters on each of them.

Returning from a combat phase to main phase does not start a new main phase but resumes the previous one. The wither trigger does not happen when returning to main phase from combat.
